SEARCH
Package access

Class OrderDAO

java.lang.Object
access.OrderDAO
public class OrderDAO extends Object
Data access object for Order - used to create orders - todo: update inventory table after adding order example usage on frontend, where extraId and drinkId are fetched from GUI interface: OrderDAO orderDAO = new OrderDAO(); int orderId = orderDAO.createOrder("Cam", 6.50, 1); orderDAO.addOrderItem(orderId, drinkId); orderDAO.addOrderExtra(orderId, extraId);

  • Method Details

    • placeOrder

      public int placeOrder(String customer, double order_total_price, int employee_id) throws SQLException
      placeOrder endpoint
      Parameters:
      customer - the name of the customer
      order_total_price - total price of the order
      employee_id - the id of the employee that placed the order
      Returns:
      generated order_id
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs during order creation

      Adds a drink item to an existing order
      Parameters:
      order_id - the ID of the order to add the item to
      drink_id - the ID of the drink to add to the order
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs during the addition

      Throws:

    • getOrderFirst

      public Timestamp getOrderFirst() throws SQLException
      Retrieves the timestamp of the earliest order in the database
      Returns:
      Timestamp of the earliest order, or null if no orders exist
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs while retrieving the timestamp

    • getTimestampsFromWindow

      public List<Timestamp> getTimestampsFromWindow(Timestamp date_first, Timestamp date_last)
      Retrieves all order timestamps that fall within a specified time window
      Parameters:
      date_first - the start timestamp of the time window
      date_last - the end timestamp of the time window
      Returns:
      a List of Timestamps containing all order dates within the specified window
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if a database error occurs while retrieving the timestamps

    • getDrinkOrdersFromWindow

      public List<String> getDrinkOrdersFromWindow(Timestamp dateFirst, Timestamp dateLast)
      Retrieves a list of drinks ordered within a specified time window, along with the count of each drink ordered
      Parameters:
      dateFirst - the start timestamp of the time window
      dateLast - the end timestamp of the time window
      Returns:
      a List of Strings where each string contains the name of a drink, ordered by amount ordered in the given time frame
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if a database error occurs while retrieving the drink orders

    • getDrinkOrdersTotalsFromWindow

      public List<String> getDrinkOrdersTotalsFromWindow(Timestamp dateFirst, Timestamp dateLast)
      Retrieves a list of drinks ordered within a specified time window, along with the count of each drink ordered
      Parameters:
      dateFirst - the start timestamp of the time window
      dateLast - the end timestamp of the time window
      Returns:
      a List of Strings where each string is the total number of orders for each individual drink
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if a database error occurs while retrieving the drink orders

    • getDrinkOrdersRevenueFromWindow

      public List<String> getDrinkOrdersRevenueFromWindow(Timestamp dateFirst, Timestamp dateLast)
      Retrieves a list of drinks ordered within a specified time window, along with the count of each drink ordered
      Parameters:
      dateFirst - the start timestamp of the time window
      dateLast - the end timestamp of the time window
      Returns:
      a List of Strings where each string is the total revenue generated by each drink the the given time window
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if a database error occurs while retrieving the drink orders
